turns.speaker: MONSTER
turns.text: MMMmmmmmm.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Don't you think I know that?  But what are you judging by?  Bucharest??? This was always a hick town.  They can't get a 'Bus and Truck' company to come in here.  Are you going to let these idiots get the best of you? ...Or are you going to stand up like a man and show them that you've got more dignity in your little finger than they've got in all their beer- bloated bodies put together?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: What's that tune that you're playing

turns.speaker: OLD VIOLINIST
turns.text: Zis is an old Transylvanian Lullaby.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: How sweet!  Such a quaint little tune.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: May I see your violin?

turns.speaker: OLD VIOLINIST
turns.text: It's an honor for me, sir.  You play the violin?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Oh, just a little.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Nice!  Nice little balance to it.

turns.speaker: OLD VIOLINIST
turns.text: Ja, ja.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Extremely well.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: How nice.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Did you have a pleasant trip?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Yes, thank you.  It wasn't bad.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Did you ever have a roll in the hay?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I'm not sure I...get your drift.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Sometimes I'm afraid of the lightning.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Just an atmospheric discharge. Nothing to be afraid of.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Are you busy?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: That's quite all right.  What is it, dear?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Could I lie down in your bed for a little while?  I just can't sleep.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: We only arrived a few minutes ago.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I know, but usually I can fall asleep right away.  It must be the strange room.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh please -- just till I get sleepy. Then you can force me right back to my room.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Well.. I suppose it would be all right, for just a little while.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Would you like a sandwich?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: No, thanks!  I want to get right to sleep.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Well... I'll just finish unpacking.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Inga!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes, you may... but don't make any noise.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Inga, wake up!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: What is it?  Is something wrong, Doctor?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Listen!  Don't you hear that strange music?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes!  What could it be at this hour?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I don't know.  It just woke me up.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Dr. Fronkonsteen -- look!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Whatever it is, it's coming from down there.  I'm going down to see.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Let me come with you, Doctor, please!  I don't want to stay up here alone.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: All right then, quietly!  Close your robe and stay right behind me. Don't make a sound!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Ooh!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: What a filthy mess.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Look, Doctor!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Well, this explains the music.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: But who was playing it?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh, doctor!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Perhaps we'd better leave.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: 'As the minuteness of the parts formed a great hindrance to my speed, I resolved to make the Creature of a gigantic stature.' Of course!  That would simplify everything.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: And look at this, Doctor!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: 'Dilation of his sacral parasympathetic impulses would cause an increase in flow of blood and the erection to approximately nineteen inches of his apparatus genitals.'

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Soon, all the electrical secrets of Heaven shall be mine.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh, Frederick... you're not only a great doctor, you're a great... you're almost a...

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: A god?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Right here?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Raise the platform, hurry!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh!  Yes, Doctor.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Reputation.  Reputation!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I thought it was wonderful.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I don't understand -- I followed the notes to the letter.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: It wasn't me.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Look here -  if it wasn't you, and it wasn't you, and it wasn't me...

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh, Doctor!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I think you've done it, master.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Alive!  Look at it.  I have defeated death!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: It looks that way.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: What do you think we should do?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I think I'll...carry him.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Do you think you can sing it?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Me?  Sing?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Yes -- quickly, dear!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I'd be so nervous.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: This is not the finals -- just sing!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: It's some-thing dar-ing, 'The Con-ti-nen-tal,' A way of danc-ing that's real-ly ul-tra new; It's ver-y sub-tle, 'The Con-ti-nen-tal.'

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: It has a pas-sion, 'The Con-ti nen-tal...'

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Stop -- singing!!!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: All right -- give it to him!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Are you serious??

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Give him the sedative!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh!  Yes, Doctor.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Did you do it?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Good!  It shouldn't take more than a few seconds.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Good night, Doctor.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Good night!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Why, doctor...how wonderful for you.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Wonderful?  It's terrible! Terrible, terrible, terrible, terrible, terrible!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Just passing through the night.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: What's wrong, Doctor?  You seem... lonely.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Oh, a little.  But it's not just physical loneliness.  It's the pangs that come from missing someone intellectually... as I have you.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I've missed you intellectually, too, Doctor.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: It's terrible -- the price society demands in the name of fidelity... ultimately?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Not fooling around.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I know, but I mean -- not fooling around physically?... Or not fooling around intellectually?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I see what you mean.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: There can never... ever... be anything physical between us. You know that, dear.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I know Frederick.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: It wouldn't be fair to Elizabeth.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I say, it wouldn't be fair to you... or to me.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Nor to Elizabeth.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: No.  Nor to Elizabeth.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: We all have our feelings.  I know that I have mine.  And... I wouldn't want to hurt yours.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: And Elizabeth has hers.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Yes, Elizabeth has hers.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: But, after all, you have yours.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Yes, I have mine.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: And I have mine.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Yes...yes, you have yours.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Why don't we talk inside?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Well...  ... perhaps for a few minutes.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: It wouldn't be fair to her.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: You've got to help me to remain faithful.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes, I will.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: ...But an intellectual relationship, like this -- we could have as often as we wanted.  Three times a day -- anything!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: All right if I turn out the lamp, sweetheart?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: MMmmm.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: MMMMmmmmm!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes, sweetie...I heard you.  So! I'm ready for you, meine Liebe.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Are you ready for me?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: MMMMmmmmm!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Ready for Fuchsmachen???

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: MMMMMMmmmmmmmmm!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I love it when you're excited.  Come then, my Apfelstrudel!  Come into my arms and let me hold you.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Sweetheart.....Is this really you???

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: MMMMMMMMMMMMMMmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: No, not sound.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: There must have been someone else down here then.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: His what??

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: His schwanzstucker.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Whew!  A nineteen-inch drill.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: It's working!  Oh, Doctor -- you play beautifully.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Do you know the theme from 'Doctor Zhivago'?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I'm getting tired.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Why don't we all turn in?  It's been a long day.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Look how far we've come.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: You can't expect to iron out all the kinks in one night.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: I think the doctor is a genius! Don't you, Igor?

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Why certainly.  Don't you, Frau Blucher?

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: How do you know they're done?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: The doctor said to allow seven minutes:  no more and no less -- or else they could both become hopelessly paralyzed.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: How long is it so far?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Four

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Three minutes to go!

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: What d'ya want to do to kill time?

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Oh, Igor -- I'm so afraid!  I just hope this all ends well.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Igor -- are you sure the monster has a good brain?  Are you absolutely certain that you took the brain of Hans Delbruck that night?

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Absolutely!  May my mother grow two heads if I'm not telling the truth.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Sounds like visitors.  It's all right -- Frau Blucher will show them in.

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Oh, must be around ten... ten-thirty.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Igor -- the clock!  Hurry!

turns.speaker: IGOR
turns.text: Another fifteen seconds to go.

turns.speaker: INGA
turns.text: Do Something!  Stall them!

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Yes, sir, name, please?

turns.speaker: MONSTER
turns.text: Food!

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Do you have a reservation?

turns.speaker: MONSTER
turns.text: Food!!

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir.  We only seat by reservation.

turns.speaker: MONSTER
turns.text: Drink!

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Oh, no sir-ee.  If yo don't have a reservation you can skip to ma-loo.

turns.speaker: MONSTER
turns.text: Foooooood!

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Now just one moment.  There's no need for roughhousing.  Have you ever tried a tip?

turns.speaker: MONSTER
turns.text: GRRRHMMNNNJKJMMMNN!

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Franz!  Help!  Lunatic!

turns.speaker: BOY-PULLEN
turns.text: Will you hear "Last Post", Sir?

turns.speaker: BLOOMFIELD
turns.text: I listened extra careful to your "Stand To" this mornin', Boy. ft was peifecL I couldn't 've done it better meseif, not even when I was Bugler to The Duke Of Wellington.. .now tell me, where did you get that black eye?

turns.speaker: BOY-PULLEN
turns.text: From the Cook, Sir They saw me dip your shaving tin in the tea-water this morning, made their tea taste of Lifebuoy toilet soap, they saij Handing him the bottle of gin he purloined earlier. 2t

turns.speaker: BLOOMFIELD
turns.text: So, you got it in the line of dooty.. ... point taken.

turns.speaker: BOY-PULLEN
turns.text: Will we be fighting the Zulus soo~, Quartermaster? .

turns.speaker: BLOOMFIELD
turns.text: Could be.  Across the river into Zululand. . They might just be waiting there for us to show up... .them stabbing assegais pointing right at our bellies!....

turns.speaker: BOY-PULLEN
turns.text: You afeared of the Zulus then, Quartermaster?

turns.speaker: BLOOMFIELD
turns.text: One Zulu is only one man.. ..and I'm afeared of no one man... but the Zulu, they come in the thousands.... like a black wave of death.... in the thousands.... and them assegais.... stabbing!

turns.speaker: BOY-PULLEN
turns.text: Why don 't the Zulus attack?

turns.speaker: BLOOMFIELD
turns.text: Zulu may not wear shoes or trousers and the like but it don 't mean to say they got no brains. They'll watch us  and wait  and find our weaknesses.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: An historical moment, Gentlemen.

turns.speaker: NORRIS-NEWMAN
turns.text: Excuse me, My Lord.  Norris-Newman, of "The Standard", My Lord.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: 1 saw you lead our Cavalry sir

turns.speaker: NORRIS-NEWMAN
turns.text: Indeedldid, MyLord. Itwas one ofthe first to cross.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Were they in good heart as they entered enemy territory?

turns.speaker: NORRIS-NEWMAN
turns.text: They spurred onto high ground, My Lord, full of spirit and looking for the Zulu. Full of sport they were, My Lord.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Tell what you see. Write it well, Sir, and make sure you get it right

turns.speaker: NORRIS-NEWMAN
turns.text: If I've got it right, My Lord, you lead an invasion into Zululand, for I see it all around me, but "why?" is the question my readers will ask. "why?"

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Do not confuse yourse{fi Why? We must strike a heavy blow. This cannot be a war of manoeuvre.

turns.speaker: NORRIS-NEWMAN
turns.text: So attack is your defence. Well let's hope Cetshwayo will offer his Impis full destruction.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: My only fear is that the Zulu will avoid the engagement

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: What o'clock is it, Mr Noggs?

turns.speaker: NORRIS-NEWMAN
turns.text: Eleven o'clock, My LorJ 42

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Our friend Colonel Dumford will be  should be   at this minute approaching Pulleine. I think we'll eat here. I want to scout that mountain top and be back with an appetite in one hour. .

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Splendid horsemanship  Who are they?

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: Sikali Horse, My Lord. Christians alL I know each one by name.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: They come well recommended do they? DURNFORD

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Oh... indeed. Crealock, we should see that Colonel Dumford has an Officer for his hard riders. Perhaps a subaltern from the Twenty Fourth.

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: I thought it might be more effective to find someone who speaks Zulu.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Excellent. Thank you.  Give them to Crealock, would you?

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: My Lord.  This list was prepared for you. I don 't think another can understand its true value.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: You intended to bring your reserves across the river?

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: I have received intelligence from, sources of my own that the Zulu Impis are moving North of here and threaten your left.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Intelligence? Sources of your own? Did it not occur to you they may be native rumours? Rumours to draw you off- to leave the whole ofNatal open to a possible counter thrust

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Are you dictating the strategy of this war, Sir?

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: I'm explaining my reasons.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Tomorrow we will continue our advance on Ulundi. Dumford, kindly return to your unit Bring them here immediately to support Pulleine. Mr Vereker will join you as ADC. Do you understand me clearly?

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: And the threat of counter invasion no longer exists? 40

turns.speaker: CREALOCK
turns.text: Yes. I see you've issued each of them with a Martini Henry Carbine. Our quota for Native contingencies: one rifle to ten men and only five rounds per rifle.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: But will they make good use of them?

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: What's that strange name the newspaper chap's called?

turns.speaker: CREALOCK
turns.text: Er, called Noggs, Sir Actual name is Norris-Newman. He presented credentials from "The Standard".

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Our runners bare his dispatches, do they not?

turns.speaker: CREALOCK
turns.text: The only reports of enemy activity have come from the direction of the Royal Kraal, at Ulundi.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: CREALOCK
turns.text: A large party of Zulus have been sighted in the direction of the King's KraaL Getting up, CHELMSFORD moves over to look at the map on his desk.

turns.speaker: CHELMSFORD
turns.text: Splendid site, Crealock, splendil I want to establish Camp here immediately.

turns.speaker: CREALOCK
turns.text: Certainly, Sin

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: Stuart?

turns.speaker: STUART SMITH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: How quickly can you move your artillery forward?

turns.speaker: STUART SMITH
turns.text: Well, my horses are feeding, as you may observe, Mr Coghill. It'll take a little while.

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: Well, fed or hungry, Pulleine wants them in position immediately. .

turns.speaker: STUART SMITH
turns.text: Right.  Bombardier, to me please.

turns.speaker: MELVILL
turns.text: Lighting COGHILL' 5 cigar: Our good Colonel Dumford scored quite a coup with the Sikali Horse.

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: Um. There are rumours that my Lord Chelmsford intends to make Durnford Second in Command.

turns.speaker: MELVILL
turns.text: Well that's typical of Her Majesty's army. Appoint an engineer to do a soldier's work.

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: Do you think she might be interested in  someone?

turns.speaker: MELVILL
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: Well that one. The one who keeps looking at me.

turns.speaker: MELVILL
turns.text: ft could be you flatter yourself CoghilL It's that odd eye.

turns.speaker: COGHILL
turns.text: Choose your targets men. That's right Watch those markers. 55

turns.speaker: MELVILL
turns.text: Keep steady. You're the best shots of the Twenty-Fourth. You bunch of heathens, do it

turns.speaker: VEREKER
turns.text: Colonel Durnford... William Vereker. I hear you 've been seeking Officers?

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: Good ones, yes, Mr Vereker. Gentlemen who can ride and shoot

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: Your orders, Mr Vereker?

turns.speaker: VEREKER
turns.text: I'm to take the Sikali with the main column to the river

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: Lord Chelmsford seems to want me to stay back with my Basutos.

turns.speaker: VEREKER
turns.text: I think Chelmsford wants a good man on the border Why he fears a flanking attack and requires a steady Commander in reserve.

turns.speaker: VEREKER
turns.text: Well I assure you, Sir, I have no desire to create difficulties. 45

turns.speaker: DURNFORD
turns.text: And I assure you, you do not In fact I'd be obliged for your best advice. What have your scouts seen?

turns.speaker: VEREKER
turns.text: So far only their scouts. But we have had reports of a small Impi farther north, over there.
